channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pollution from local Landry, 21st August
item.description:
Masses of polystyrene beads and fluff from tumble dryers (possibly from local laundry) have spoiled and are blowing around various areas near Coronation Square. Especially bad near The Oasis and in the Coronation Square car park. If you catch it soon, it might not have blown all over town!

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Signs & Street Furniture problem, 21st August
item.description:

item.title: Flytipping at entrance to park Hanover St, 21st August
item.description:
Lots of large cardboard boxes Flytipped next to the bin at the entrance to Pittville Park from Hanover St. also nearby, pieces of wood Flytipped on the pavement against the fence of 85 Marle Marle Hill Road (Hanover St side). Given recent arson events nearby, please can these be removed promptly

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flag tied to streetlight, 21st August
item.description:
Union flag tied to streetlight, just below the lantern. Possibly obscuring beam. Post number 1 on Courtenay Street, outside number 47

Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Incomplete/abandoned park, 20th August
item.description:
An open space in Brockworth, opposite the David Lloyds club car parking entrance, had works started on it to install outdoor gym equipment and some seating. It however seems incomplete with random apparatus left about and rubbish I assumed the builders would have removed. Their were gates that had cornered the park off but one side is bent and moved, which has led to the one the other side being removed for easier access. I have seen multiple children playing in this unfinished area and am concerned for their safety. I would appreciate this area being completed and or properly made safe until it can be completed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Golf Club Lane, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders rubble, 20th August
item.description:
Mostly bricks & bit of rubble dumped on entrance to footpath in Brockhampton lane going up from level crossing to Swindon Village.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop has a tiny stop number on the metal sign, 20th August
item.description:
The bus stops on The Promenade have a very tiny stop number on the metal plate that is attached to the top of each bus shelter. It is difficult for someone with full sight to see the bus stop number; if someone has poor sight, it is unlikely that they will be able to see the number at all. Could bigger numbers be put on the shelters, please? This would help people who have sight conditions to find their bus stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Promenade, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike rack not fixed, 20th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64a, Tennyson Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Inadequate markings or signage, 20th August
item.description:
At the very end of Finchcroft Lane nearest the cemetery there is space to enable vehicles to turn round. Today there were two vans parked there making the turning incredibly awkward. Can there be some markings or a sign to keep this area clear please. An emergency response vehicle would not be able to turn round when there is a vehicle in the space.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finchcroft Lane, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues
